<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 728, 711]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 77, 744, 108]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\frac{\mathrm{e}^{x} + 2\mathrm{e}^{-x}}{\mathrm{e}^{x} - 3} = 4\). Give your answer correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 114, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 78, 96, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 78, 146, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 78, 920, 115]]<|/det|>
Expand \((6 - x)(1 - 2x)^{-\frac{3}{2}}\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^2\), simplifying the coefficients. [4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 123, 915, 641]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 653, 148, 670]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 653, 620, 670]]<|/det|>
State the set of values of \(x\) for which the expansion is valid. [1]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 679, 915, 925]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 945, 316, 970]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[452, 945, 544, 958]]<|/det|>
9709/32/M/J/25

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
On an Argand diagram shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) which satisfy both the inequalities \(|z - 3\mathrm{i}|\leqslant 2\) and \(\frac{1}{4}\pi \leqslant \arg (z - 1 - 2\mathrm{i})\leqslant \frac{3}{4}\pi .\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 94, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 579, 90]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(3\cot x - 4\cot 2x = 3\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 90]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
The square roots of \(-1 - 4\sqrt{5}\mathrm{i}\) can be expressed in the Cartesian form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\) , where \(x\) and \(y\) are real and exact.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
By first forming a quartic equation in \(x\) or \(y\), find the square roots of \(-1 - 4\sqrt{5}\mathrm{i}\) in exact Cartesian form. [5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 165, 915, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 70, 94, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 70, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 70, 636, 88]]<|/det|>
By sketching a suitable pair of graphs, show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 100, 566, 121]]<|/det|>
\[|x - 2| = 2\sin {\frac{1}{2}}x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 500, 151]]<|/det|>
has only one root in the interval \(0 < x < \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 505, 148, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 505, 602, 523]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that this root lies between 1 and 1.5.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 505, 920, 523]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 534, 917, 925]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 77, 146, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 77, 920, 115]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(x_{n + 1} = 2 - 2\sin \frac{1}{2} x_n\) with an initial value of 1.03 to calculate the root correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places. [3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 123, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 96, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 76, 148, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 76, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
Express \(7 \sin \theta + 24 \cos \theta\) in the form \(R \cos (\theta - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0 < \alpha < \frac{1}{2} \pi\). Give the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 87, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 123, 917, 952]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 73, 536, 91]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(\theta\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 100, 608, 128]]<|/det|>
\[\sin 2\theta \frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}\theta} = (4x + 3)\cos 2\theta ,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 135, 324, 154]]<|/det|>
and \(x = 0\) when \(\theta = \frac{1}{12}\pi\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 165, 702, 183]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation and obtain an expression for \(x\) in terms of \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 165, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 196, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 754, 90]]<|/det|>
With respect to the origin \(O\) , the points \(A\) , \(B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 98, 740, 153]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix}, \qquad \overrightarrow{OB} = \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \qquad \text{and} \qquad \overrightarrow{OC} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 5 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 146, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 165, 559, 183]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for the line through \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 917, 492]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 505, 148, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 505, 591, 523]]<|/det|>
Using a scalar product, find the exact value of \(\cos BAC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 505, 920, 523]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 537, 917, 925]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 485, 88]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact area of triangle \(ABC\).

<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 103, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 650, 93]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(x^{2}\) is divided by \(1 + 4x^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 75, 920, 93]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 103, 917, 655]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 661, 480, 691]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{0.5} x \tan^{-1}(2x) \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 662, 920, 681]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<label>11</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[363, 88, 633, 269]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 285, 848, 305]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = 5 \sin 2x \cos^2 x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2} \pi\) and its maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 318, 146, 336]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 318, 420, 336]]<|/det|>
Find the exact \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 318, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 345, 917, 925]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 918, 110]]<|/det|>
By using the substitution \(u = \cos x\), find the area of the region bounded by the curve, the \(x\)-axis between \(x = 0\) and \(x = \frac{1}{4}\pi\), and the line \(x = \frac{1}{4}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
